
The problem is that the watcher reports events at the old, deleted path, not in the new dir:

```
2020-11-09 20:37:33 marking file as deleted Directory{Name:"Untitled Folder", Sequence:2479, Permissions:0775, ModTime:2020-11-09 20:37:33.854882291 +0100 CET, Version:{[{BCROSJ5 1604950653} {FPE4P7T 1603469496}]}, VersionHash:, Deleted:true, Invalid:false, LocalFlags:0x0, NoPermissions:false}
[...]
2020-11-09 20:38:18 sendreceive/default@0xc000306700 Scan due to watcher
2020-11-09 20:38:18 Walk [Untitled Folder/a] Matcher/[]@0xc001236360
2020-11-09 20:38:18 Walk progress done default [Untitled Folder/a] Matcher/[]@0xc001236360
2020-11-09 20:38:18 sendreceive/default@0xc000306700 Scan due to watcher
2020-11-09 20:38:18 Walk [Untitled Folder/Untitled Folder] Matcher/[]@0xc001236360
2020-11-09 20:38:18 Walk progress done default [Untitled Folder/Untitled Folder] Matcher/[]@0xc001236360
```

Triggering a manual full scan should detect the changes and get everything in sync again.

rename.to: File not detected due to watching reporting events on old, deleted path

body: Triggering a manual full scan on System 1 did sync everything, but is this a bug that can be fixed?

Likely. It's something wrong with notify. A more minimal reproducer:

1. Create dir a.
2. Rename a to b.
3. Create file c in b.

Expected: File in b is scanned.

Actual: It isn't scanned. Debug logging shows that the watch triggers a scan on a/c, not b/c.

issue.title: inotify: Fix path when renaming dir in recursive watch

repository.name: notify
repository.description: File system event notification library on steroids.

issue.body:
Steps to reproduce (or just run the test in the PR):

1. Create recursive watch.
2. Create a dir A.
3. Rename the dir to B.
4. Create a file at B/foo

Expected: Event at B/foo

Actual: Event at A/foo

The main fix is in line 100: The path needs to updated too.

I also changed the locking, as both branches of the if require a write-lock, thus acquiring a read-lock first is pointless.

The issue was originally reported in https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/7076

body: Any update on this as the other repository has merged the fix?

issue.title: build: Update notify (fixes #7076)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

milestone.title: v1.13.0
milestone.description: This release adds configuration options for min/max connections (see https://docs.syncthing.net/advanced/option-connection-limits.html) and moves the storage of pending devices/folders from the config to the database (see https://docs.syncthing.net/dev/rest.html#cluster-endpoints).

issue.body: Pulls in the fix for #7076 in upstream and brings us back in sync with upstream.

body:
Was hoping for another merge in time for 1.12.1-rc.1, and forgot to update the dependency in time. So the fix will be delayed until the next release, sorry and thanks for the reminder.
https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/pull/7189

issue.title: Removing a folder and re-adding it again (untrusted) makes it not sync until restart

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

milestone.title: v1.15.0
milestone.description:
This release fixes a vulnerability where Syncthing and the relay server can crash due to malformed relay protocol messages (CVE-2021-21404); see https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/security/advisories/GHSA-x462-89pf-6r5h.

This release updates the CLI to use subcommands and adds the subcommands `cli` (previously standalone `stcli` utility) and `decrypt` (for offline verifying and decrypting encrypted folders).

With this release we invite everyone to test the "untrusted (encrypted) devices" feature. You should not use it yet on important production data. Thus UI controls are hidden behind a feature flag. For more information, visit: 
https://forum.syncthing.net/t/testing-untrusted-encrypted-devices/16470

issue.body: Most likely because the other side has cached the fact that we already had index information and won't send it again, even though we've dropped our index data.
